Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: An Electronic Subconscious For Lifelong Learning
Award.AbstractNarration:
This SBIR Phase I project is a fully synergistic educational framework that addresses learning, retention, and presentation, with the potential to improve the educational outcomes for society at large. By maximizing the work done in a limited timeframe, immediate beneficiaries will be underrepresented minority students. This product will accelerate the taking of science to the society, and the society to the next frontier of science. It has ubiquitous application to all adult learning communities, including colleges, healthcare, governmental organizations, and private corporations. This solution augments some highly used current educational technologies with engagement mechanisms that greatly accelerate the learning process, personalize it, and persist this personalized knowledge so as to make it continually available to the learner. This innovation creates a layer of intelligence that is common to all of those involved in learning, and uses it to personalize a user's next learning experience. It avoids grappling with the plethora of learning technologies (e.g., learning management systems, conference management systems, continuing education companies, and content hosting software) by exploiting the virtues of a select set of ubiquitous educational technologies and at the same time compensating for many of their drawbacks. The solution generates and exploits appropriate user engagement data to drive the persistent intelligence layer.

This innovation is a framework that supports learning through a network of intelligent personal assistants that shadow a learning community and interact to enhance both the individual and the group learning experience. It exploits existing teaching pedagogies augmented with big data analytics to provide a disruptive result while ensuring a low barrier to adoption. It is unique because it works with existing practices and provides powerful visualizations of interactivity that can be used to evolve both teaching and learning practices.

POR.DRECONTENT:
There is no comprehensive technological solution in the marketplace, following sound pedagogical principles, that supports the teacher in creating high quality interactive teaching materials nor supports the student to actively engage with such material in a way that is tailored to the students’ pace and ability to learn. We believe, and our customers attest to the fact, that our product does these things and more.

Our product, DialedIn, enhances the learning experiences by introducing interactivity and continuity (i.e., relevance to prior context). Interactivity is needed to engage learners and continuity is needed to retain and build upon prior knowledge. Both of these needs are becoming more important because of increasingly larger knowledge bases in critical areas like healthcare and sciences.  Our product meets these two needs: (a) without asking too much from faculty who are already under significant time constraints, and (b) by adding interactivity and continuity into pre-existing educational content since in most settings the faculty already have significant collective intellectual property in pre-existing content.

DialedIn is changing the way that students learn and the way that teachers teach in middle and high schools to post-secondary schools and universities across the country. It is allowing teachers to work more productively - working smarter rather than harder. By making use of pre-existing educational materials, our product does not require teachers to do more work. Rather the product automatically adds value to this material in the manner described above. Furthermore, it is engaging students through technology with which they are comfortable and which they use on a daily basis.

The DialedIn advantage: the learning market is served by a large number of niche solutions, and therefore a system capable of delivering a pedagogically complete solution needs to be composed of a number of these solutions. A modern learning framework is thus composed of a collection of specialized components, each of which comes from a different provider. Whereas, it might appear as these systems are seamlessly integrated, this is often not the case since these systems do not share data in a manner that results in enhancing the overall learning experience. DialedIn is different. Therefore,  DialedIn in its current incarnation, which is only one step in its longer term roadmap, brings value to the market which is beyond the reach of all other competitors. It offers solutions in multiple categories. The fact that DialedIn operates in multiple spaces gives it the added advantage of being able to share data between the functional categories it supports in a seamless manner to enable enhanced functionality.
